2:
At the appointed time I will judge fairly.
\q
3:
Though the earth and all the inhabitants shake in fear,
\q I make steady the earth's pillars.
\qs Selah\qs*
4:
I said to the arrogant, "Do not be arrogant,"
\q and to the wicked, "Do not lift up the horn.
\q
6:
It is not from the east or from the west,
\q and it is not from the wilderness that lifting up comes.
8:
For Yahweh holds in his hand a cup of foaming wine,
\q which is mixed with spices, and pours it out.
\q Surely all the wicked of the earth will drink it to the last drop.
10:
He says, "I will cut off all the horns of the wicked,
\q but the horns of the righteous will be raised up."
75:
\m
\d For the chief musician; set to Al Tashheth. A psalm of Asaph, a song.
\q
